info.name: Magpie API
info.description:
# Introduction
This is the API for magpiehunt.com

# Overview
https://github.com/rkwitz/magpie-php

# Authentication
The API requires an Authentication header of type Bearer in every API request. The token should be grabbed from the user's Firebase login.
ex header:

`Authentication Bearer *base64 encoded token goes here*`

# Error Codes
* 200 - OK
* 401 - Unauthorized
* 404 - Resource Not Found
* 405 - The operation requested is not supported. Usually this means that the state of the Resource doesn't allow that action (you can't edit an 'approved' Hunt).

# Error Reporting
Please submit an issue on the Github page, or email admin*AT*magpiehunt.com

# Updating Resources
Updating a Resource replaces all content with the data sent.

item.name: Hunts
item.description:
Perform actions on Hunts.

Note: Hunt states cannot be user set but are one of:
* `approved`
* `submitted`
* `non-approved`

request.description: Get all Hunts that the current user owns.

response.name: Get all hunts - No Hunts Found

header.name: Connection
header.description: Options that are desired for the connection

header.name: Content-Encoding
header.description: The type of encoding used on the data.

header.name: Content-Length
header.description: The length of the response body in octets (8-bit bytes)

header.name: Content-Type
header.description: The mime type of this content

header.name: Date
header.description: The date and time that the message was sent

header.name: Server
header.description: A name for the server

header.name: Vary
header.description: Tells downstream proxies how to match future request headers to decide whether the cached response can be used rather than requesting a fresh one from the origin server.

header.name: Access-Control-Allow-Methods
header.description: Specifies the method or methods allowed when accessing the resource. This is used in response to a preflight request.

header.name: Access-Control-Allow-Origin
header.description: Specifies a URI that may access the resource. For requests without credentials, the server may specify '*' as a wildcard, thereby allowing any origin to access the resource.

request.description: Submit a Hunt for approval by an admin.  Once submitted, Hunts cannot be modified and subresources cannot be modified, deleted, or altered.  This action locks down the Hunt.  However, Hunts can be deleted.
